Detailed Description

This class represents the objective functional of a multilayer perceptron for the brachistochrone problem. The brachistochrone problem for the multilayer perceptron can be stated as a variational problem with one input and one output variables, two boundary conditions and an objective functional defined by an improper integral.

See also:
ObjectiveFunctional.

OrdinaryDifferentialEquations.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::BrachistochroneProblem ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron  ) 

General constructor. It creates a brachistochrone problem objective functional associated to a multilayer perceptron. It also initializes all the problem parameters to their default values:

  • xa: 0.0.
  • ya: 1.0.
  • xb: 1.0.
  • yb: 0.0.
  • Tolerance: 1.0e-6.
  • Initial size: 1000000.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.

Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::BrachistochroneProblem ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a brachistochrone problem objective functional not associated to any multilayer perceptron. It also initializes all the problem parameters to their default values:

  • xa: 0.0.
  • ya: 1.0.
  • xb: 1.0.
  • yb: 0.0.
  • Tolerance: 1.0e-6.
  • Initial size: 1000000.

Vector< double > Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::calculateParticularSolution ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the particular solution term phi0(x) in order to satisfy the boundary conditions for the brachistochrone problem. It must hold phi0(xa)=ya if there is a condition y(xa)=ya.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.
See also:
calculateHomogeneousSolution.

calculateParticularSolutionDerivative.

calculateHomogeneousSolutionDerivative.

Vector< double > Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::calculateHomogeneousSolution ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the homogeneous solution term phi1(x) in order to satisfy the boundary conditions for the brachistochrone problem. It must hold phi1(xa)=0 if there is a condition y(xa)=ya.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.
See also:
calculateParticularSolution.

calculateHomogeneousSolutionDerivative.

Vector< double > Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::calculateParticularSolutionDerivative ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the derivative of the particular solution term, phi0'(x), which will be used to compute the derivative of the descent curve, y'(x), in the brachistochrone problem.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.

double  dummy 
)

Referenced by calculateDescentTime().

double Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::calculateDescentTime ( void   ) 

This method integrates the descent time integrand function to obtain the time to travel from point A to point B for the chute represented by the neural network. Note that the integral is performed with an ordinary differential equations approach.

See also:
calculateDescentTimeIntegrand.

Definition at line 505 of file BrachistochroneProblem.cpp.

References calculateDescentTimeIntegrand(), Flood::OrdinaryDifferentialEquations::calculateRungeKuttaFehlbergIntegral(), ordinaryDifferentialEquations, xA, and xB.

Referenced by calculateEvaluation().

double Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::calculateEvaluation ( void   )  [virtual]

This method returns the objective functional evaluation of a multilayer perceptron for the brachistochrone problem. This is simply the descent time of the curve represented by the neural network.

Implements Flood::ObjectiveFunctional.

References calculateDescentTime(), Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::multilayerPerceptron, and Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::numberOfEvaluations.

void Flood::BrachistochroneProblem::saveResults ( char *  filename  )
